#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Liberal candidate Brian Jackson , Oxford
#Text=Monday , October 1 , 2007
#Text=is running for the Ontario Liberal Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Oxford riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I have always been involved in the community and various causes .
#Text=I used to talk about how to make things better , so when I was approaching retirement from teaching , my friends said “ get off your butt and do it . ”
#Text=So , the day after I retired , I won the Oxford Liberal nomination .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=I have had a number positions in my church , in the community and in fundraising associations .

#Text=While I have never held , or run for political office , I believe my educational background can bring much experience to ensure the area is addressing the needs the students and the employers of Oxford .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ?
#Text=Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=Obviously , the incumbent is the one to beat .
#Text=He has been the sitting member for twelve years .
#Text=I hear at the doors that it is time for a change in Oxford , and I believe that I bring a fresh voice to the riding .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Education , health care , and jobs are the three most important things I hear from the people I talk to .
#Text=I want to address education and jobs by expanding the trade school opportunities in the riding , to train the skilled trades people that we will require right here .
#Text=Long-term care is important in the riding , and I will work to expand and improve the facilities in the riding .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=We need to continue the work done by the ministry of Economic Development to attract investment and the next generation of industrial technologies .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=That is a question best addressed by the respective municipal councils .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=We need to continue attracting the next generation of technologies .

#Text=Fuel-efficient and alternative fuel vehicles , alternative energy technologies ; any of the products that we will need to develop quickly to address the environmental challenges currently being faced .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ?
#Text=I feel that everyone should take the time to educate themselves about all aspects of this important decision and decide for themselves .
#Text=Regardless of the outcome , the referendum exercise has forced people to learn and think about our system of democracy .
#Text=Because of this , it is already a success .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc )
#Text=Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text=I have done a weekly live webcast for people to log onto and talk to me , I write a blog , and we have posted a video on YouTube .
#Text=I feel that they are beneficial in trying to attract younger voters , but we have not seen a big take-up on our efforts .
#Text=Then again , how can I compete with the Crazy Bride video ?
#Text=Of the decisions made by Ontario 's 38th Legislative Assembly , which was the most beneficial to your this electoral district ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=Which was least beneficial , or even harmful , to your this riding ?
#Text=To the province as a whole ?
#Text=By far , our riding has benefited from the Liberal Government ’s investment in the Auto Fund which , among other things , attracted the new Toyota plant to the riding of Oxford .
